intro: Biondia parviurnula, commonly known as the small-flowered biondia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Biondia parviurnula is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
